page.title: 04CRAIGBECK FARM,MOFFAT
page.content: Craigbeck farm is a stock farm situated on the Duncrieff road,outside Moffat.Its 500 acres(300 hill,200 field),graze 95 cows, (Galloways and Blue Greys) and 3 bulls,(two Charolais and a Short-Horn).The farm also stocks 300 breeding sheep,160 Blackface which graze on the hills,and 140 in-by. The soil at Craigbeck is mainly stony,suitable only for improved grass or rough grazing.However,barley covers 20 acres of land,another 20 of forage rape,100 of silage,kale 12 and hay 50 acres.John Cullin,( owner), employs one full-time worker,and a number of seasonal workers as required.The seasons work consists of lambing and calving in April/May,clipping in June,dipping and lamb sales in July/ Aug.late calving in October.At times farming can be a demanding job but John Cullin enjoys his farming life.
